newsitem.title: CANADA: Horsham says no change to Clark USA plans.
newsitem.headline: Horsham says no change to Clark USA plans.

text.p: A shutdown at Clark Refining and Marketing Co's alkylation unit at its Chicago-area refinery will have no impact on Horsham Corp's plans to find an investor for 46-percent owned Clark USA, a Horsham spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

"We don't expect the Blue Island incident will have any impact on our plans to realize value on Clark," said Horsham's Laurie Ludwick. "We are still hopeful that we will be able to realize value in the near future," she added.
Clark Refining expects to have the alkylation unit at its 80,515-barrel-per-day Blue Island refinery back in service on Wednesday. It was shut down by fire over the weekend.
On Monday, Illinois Attorney General Jim Ryan said he planned to seek a court order to temporarily shut down the refinery until it was proven safe.
The fire last weekend was the latest in a series of safety-related incidents at the plant in recent years, Ryan said.
